org.jpws.data

Class PwsFileSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.data.PwsFileSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    OptionChangeListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PwsFileContainer

    public class PwsFileSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements OptionChangeListener
    A containment structure for a PwsFile to deal with backend tasks.

    This class serves several primary purposes:

    A) synchronize multi-threaded operations on a database,
    B) organise a sorted and filtered representation of the record list
    C) make available several backend operations not present on the lean database interface
    D) organise automatic backup copies of the database
    E) implement functionality to dispatch events about property changes of the container or file events (modify event)
    F) implement file specific persistent options interface (getOptions())

    This class dispatches events of type ChangeEvent. The static member class of this class or the Java class javax.swing.event.ChangeEvent can be used to receive events. Only the member class, however, allows to identify the modified container property or event type. The Java interface javax.swing.event.ChangeListener is used for listeners. There are two event types dispatched from this class:
    MODIFY_EVENT : dispatched on each modification of the content or definition of the database; also dispatched when the file becomes "unmodified" (e.g. save performed)
    FILTER_MODE : dispatched when property "getFilterStatus()" changes to a new state
    As a general rule, all event types are initially dispatched upon registration of a listener.

      This class performs a selection criterion for the filter list of this container by evaluating records of the database as accepted / not-accepted.

      • getMinorOptions

        public PersistentOptions getMinorOptions()
        Returns MINOR file options. These options are meant to not necessarily constitute a file modification event when modified.

        Minor file options are not necessarily stored into the database, they may also persist on a local platform basis. The user can choose in a progam option on where minor options are to be stored.

        Returns:
        PersistentOptions

      • duplicateRecord

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord duplicateRecord(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord rec)
        Returns a duplicate record of the parameter record. The resulting record is a clone with a new UUID value and thus takes on a different identity. Create and modify time fields are set to the current system time.
        Parameters:
        rec - record to be duplicated
        Returns:
        PwsRecord

      • duplicateRecords

        public static org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] duplicateRecords(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] records)
        Returns a set of record duplicates. The duplicates bear a new UUID and have create and modify time set to current time.
        Parameters:
        records - DefaultRecordWrapper[]
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[]
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • groupDuplicates

        public org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord[] groupDuplicates(java.lang.String group)
        Returns an array of record duplicates corresponding to the set of records which is defined by the group parameter. (The resulting records will bear a new UUID and updated create and modified time.)
        Parameters:
        group - record group to be duplicated
        Returns:
        array of PwsRecord

      • createGroupVariant

        public java.lang.String createGroupVariant(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord[] recs,
                                           java.lang.String group)
        Assigns a single new GROUP value to all elements of the parameter record array. The assigned value is the second parameter's value if it is NOT already present as GROUP in this container, otherwise a variant of this value is created and used.
        Parameters:
        recs - PwsRecord[] records to be modified
        group - base GROUP value (for eventual variant group value)
        Returns:
        actually assigned group value
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getNewGroupName

        public java.lang.String getNewGroupName(java.lang.String group)
        Returns a unique GROUP value which is not yet contained in this file. If the parameter value is not contained, the parameter itself is returned. Otherwise a name is created derived from the parameter by appending a dash and a number.
        Parameters:
        group - String initial group name
        Returns:
        String new group name (extended)

      • storeFileOptions

        protected void storeFileOptions(org.jpws.pwslib.global.UUID fileUUID)
        Stores the two file option objects (MINOR and MAYOR options) into their appropriate destinations, database or local system preferences. The UUID parameter gives the file reference. If null this socket's UUID value is taken. If not null, minor options are always stored to local preferences regardless of whether they have been modified.
        Parameters:
        fileUUID - UUID key value for mapping or null for default
        Since:
        0-4-0, 0-5-0 protected (private before)

      • saveFile

        public void saveFile()
              throws JPWS_Exception,
                     java.io.IOException
        Saves the datafile of this container, provided it is in a modified state. If there is no persistent state defined for this file, UndefinedPersistencyException is thrown.
        Throws:
        JPWS_Exception, - PasswordSafeException, IOException
        JPWS_Exception
        java.io.IOException

      • emergencySave

        public boolean emergencySave()
        Saves the file in an emergency modus, if it is modified.
        Returns:
        boolean whether the file was saved or did not need to be saved

      • saveAs

        public void saveAs(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile target,
                   boolean preserveUUID)
            throws JPWS_Exception,
                   java.io.IOException
        Makes a copy of this container's datafile to a specified destination file and assumes the resulting file as persistent state of this container. (Assumption is only adopted when save was successful.) UUID of the target may change according to the "preserveUUID" parameter.
        Parameters:
        target - ContextFile target file definition
        preserveUUID - boolean if true the copy's UUID is the same as of this container, otherwise a new random value
        Throws:
        JPWS_Exception
        java.io.IOException

      • saveCopy

        public void saveCopy(org.jpws.pwslib.data.ContextFile target,
                     org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsPassphrase pass,
                     boolean preserveUUID)
              throws IO_OverrunException,
                     java.io.IOException
        Writes a copy of this container's datafile to the specified file destination. This container remains unchanged; the copy will carry a new UUID identifier according to the "preserveUUID" value.
        Parameters:
        target - ContextFile target file definition
        pass - PwsPassphrase an optional passphrase for the copy; if null the current passphrase of this container is used
        preserveUUID - boolean if true the copy's UUID is the same as of this container, otherwise a new random value
        Throws:
        IO_OverrunException
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteGroup

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] deleteGroup(java.lang.String group)
        Performs to delete a group of file entries. The parameter must denote exactly an existing group. If this group contains other groups, the delete action extends to all elements of all subgroups. If a FILTER setting is active, the delete action extends only to the filtered view of the database.
        Parameters:
        group - String, a PWS normalized GROUP value
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[] array of the deleted records (empty array if group is void)
        Since:
        0-5-0 modified return type

      • deleteEntries

        public void deleteEntries(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] set)
        Performs deleting any set of file entries. Does nothing if the selection is empty.
        Parameters:
        set - array of DefaultRecordWrapper, may be null

      • deleteRecord

        public void deleteRecord(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord rec)
        Deletes a record from this file. Does nothing if the parameter is void.
        Parameters:
        rec - PwsRecord to be deleted, may be null
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • moveEntries

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] moveEntries(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] set,
                                                                java.lang.String group,
                                                                boolean keepPaths)
        Assigns a new GROUP value to any set of records, replacing previous assignments. Does nothing if the selection is empty.
        Parameters:
        set - array of DefaultRecordWrapper, may be null
        group - a String value for the GROUP record field (may be null which is equivalent to empty)
        keepPaths -
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[] list of records actually moved or null if no operation

      • mergeDatabase

        public org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList mergeDatabase(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList list,
                                                        int modus,
                                                        boolean allowInvalids)
        Performs to incorporate a set of PwsRecords, contained in the parameter record list, into this database. A conflict solving strategy may be specified in the modus parameter, which come into effect when a record of the parameter list has an identity which is already contained in this file.

        Records incorporated through this method will be marked as IMPORTED for the lifetime of this container instance.

        Parameters:
        list -
        modus - conflict solving strategy (0 = exclude); option values are to taken from PwsRecordList
        allowInvalids - determines whether invalid records of the source are excluded (=false) or considered candidates for inclusion (=true)
        Returns:
        PwsRecordList containing records which were NOT MERGED due to conflict

      • substituteContent

        public void substituteContent(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList list)
                       throws org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException
        Replaces the database content of this container by the content of the parameter record list. If the given parameter is of type PwsFile then format version and header fields are also replaced.
        Parameters:
        list - PwsRecordList
        Throws:
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException

      • addRecordList

        public void addRecordList(org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] records)
                   throws org.jpws.pwslib.exception.PasswordSafeException

        Throws:
        org.jpws.pwslib.exception.DuplicateEntryException

      • findMatching

        public int findMatching(int index,
                        java.lang.String text,
                        boolean cs,
                        boolean wd)
        Attempts to find the next record position in the ordered list of this container whose record contains the search text as specified.
        Parameters:
        index - bounding start position, first record investigated is index + 1
        text - search text
        cs - whether search is case sensitive
        wd - whether search looks for whole words only
        Returns:
        index position in ordered list or -1 if result is void

      • getGroupRecords

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getGroupRecords(java.lang.String group)
        Returns the set of records that belong to a GROUP value of the display list. The records of subgroups are included. If the display is restricted by a FILTER setting, then the returned set is restricted accordingly. If the selection is empty, an empty array is returned.
        Parameters:
        group - complete existing group name
        Returns:
        set of record wrappers DefaultRecordWrapper

      • getAbsoluteGroupRecords

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getAbsoluteGroupRecords(java.lang.String group)
        Returns the set of records belonging to a GROUP value, including all records of subgroups. This works independent of any FILTER setting and pulls directly from the plain database. If the selection is empty, an empty array is returned. This returns fresh clones of database records.
        Parameters:
        group - complete existing group name
        Returns:
        set of record wrappers DefaultRecordWrapper
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • getImportedRecords

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] getImportedRecords(org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecordList cut)
        Returns the set of records which carry an "IMPORTED" marker.
        Parameters:
        cut - PwsRecordList if not null the result will be an intersection with this parameter
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[]
        Since:
        0-5-0

      • getGroupList

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getGroupList()
        Returns an ordered list of the GROUP field values active in this container. Only group names are shown which there are entries in the database. (Ordering follows collation rules of the actual VM default locale. This always returns not null.)
        Returns:
        java.util.List of strings

      • getFilterStatus

        public int getFilterStatus()
        Returns the current filter status for the ordered record list of this container.

      • isFiltering

        public boolean isFiltering()
        Whether this container currently applies some record list filtering. This covers both FILTER MODUS setting and QUICK FIND status.
        Returns:
        boolean true if and only if getFilterStatus() != FILTER_OFF OR isTextFindFilterActive() == true

      • setTextFindFilter

        public void setTextFindFilter(java.lang.String text)
        Modifies the current filtering of the record list of this socket so that it performs a cutset with the results of a text search in the database. The text search and filtering is triggered off by this method and the condition remains active until this method is called again with a different search text or null for disengagement.
        Parameters:
        text - String search text or null to disengage

      • refreshFilter

        public void refreshFilter()
        Resorts the current filtered list on this database.
        Since:
        0-6-0

      • getFindFilterText

        public java.lang.String getFindFilterText()
        This returns the text of the currently active find filter setup (search text) or null if no find filter is active.
        Returns:
        String search text or null

      • setExpireScope

        public void setExpireScope(long time)
        Sets the active time scope for evaluating EXPIRY status of records. This recalculates the status of all records.
        Parameters:
        time - time period in milliseconds

      • getExpireScope

        public long getExpireScope()
        Returns the active time scope for evaluating EXPIRY status of records.
        Returns:
        long milliseconds

      • renameGroup

        public org.jpws.pwslib.order.DefaultRecordWrapper[] renameGroup(java.lang.String group,
                                                                java.lang.String newname)
        Modifies the GROUP field value of a group of records. This renames only the specified SINGLE ELEMENT (last element) of a complex group name. This does nothing if the record set defined by the parameter value is empty. !! This is NOT sensitive to FILTER settings. !!
        Parameters:
        group - String to identify an existing record group
        newname - String new name for the last element in the specified GROUP field value
        Returns:
        DefaultRecordWrapper[] the set of records actually modified (empty array if operation is void)
        Since:
        0-5-0 modified return type

      • groupAncestors

        public static java.lang.String groupAncestors(java.lang.String group)
        Returns the ancestor group name of the given group name or empty string if there are no ancestors.
        Parameters:
        group - PwsRecord group value
        Returns:
        ancestor group value
        Since:
        0-6-0 public (private before)

      • moveGroup

        public void moveGroup(java.lang.String group,
                      java.lang.String target,
                      boolean replace)
        Moves a group of records (including subgroups) to a new group destination. May be seen as a GROUP rename function with the power of shifting the group to a new location in the tree. If a FILTER setting is active, this function extends only to the filtered view of the database.
        Parameters:
        group - existing GROUP name
        target - new group name
        replace - boolean true == entire group name will be replaced by new group name false == last name element of group will be preserved
        Since:
        0-6-0 additional parameter, extended semantics

      • reportPropertyChange

        protected void reportPropertyChange(int property)
        This local method reports a container property change. This will issue a change event of the container provided the value of the specified property has changed since last reporting. (It is heavily used by constitutive submodules like the view managers.)
        Parameters:
        property - one of MODIFY_EVENT, MODIFY_STATUS, FILTER_MODE (other values ignored)
